t: Ezekiel 22
Moreover*p the word of the Lord*s came unto me, saying,
Now,*p thou son of man, wilt thou judge, wilt thou judge the bloody city? yea, thou shalt shew her all her abominations.
Then*p say thou, Thus saith the Lord God,*s The city sheddeth blood in the midst of it, that her time may come, and maketh idols against herself to defile herself.

Thou*p art become guilty in thy blood that thou hast shed; and hast defiled thyself in thine idols which thou hast made; and thou hast caused thy days to draw near, and art come even unto thy years: therefore have I made thee a reproach unto the heathen, and a mocking to all countries.
Those*p that be near, and those that be far from thee, shall mock thee, which art infamous and much vexed.
Behold,*p the princes of Israel, every one were in thee to their power to shed blood.
In*p thee have they set light by father and mother: in the midst of thee have they dealt by oppression with the stranger: in thee have they vexed the fatherless and the widow.
Thou*p hast despised mine holy things, and hast profaned my sabbaths.
In*p thee are men that carry tales to shed blood: and in thee they eat upon the mountains: in the midst of thee they commit lewdness.
In*p thee have they discovered their fathers' nakedness: in thee have they humbled her that was set apart for pollution.
And*p one hath committed abomination with his neighbour's wife; and another hath lewdly defiled his daughter in law; and another in thee hath humbled his sister, his father's daughter.
In*p thee have they taken gifts to shed blood; thou hast taken usury and increase, and thou hast greedily gained of thy neighbours by extortion, and hast forgotten me, saith the Lord God.*s
Behold,*p therefore I have smitten mine hand at thy dishonest gain which thou hast made, and at thy blood which hath been in the midst of thee.
Can*p thine heart endure, or can thine hands be strong, in the days that I shall deal with thee? I the Lord*s have spoken it, and will do it.
And*p I will scatter thee among the heathen, and disperse thee in the countries, and will consume thy filthiness out of thee.
And*p thou shalt take thine inheritance in thyself in the sight of the heathen, and thou shalt know that I am the Lord.*s
And*p the word of the Lord*s came unto me, saying,
Son*p of man, the house of Israel is to me become dross: all they are brass, and tin, and iron, and lead, in the midst of the furnace; they are even the dross of silver.
Therefore*p thus saith the Lord God;*s Because ye are all become dross, behold, therefore I will gather you into the midst of Jerusalem.

As*p they gather silver, and brass, and iron, and lead, and tin, into the midst of the furnace, to blow the fire upon it, to melt it; so will I gather you in mine anger and in my fury, and I will leave you there, and melt you.
Yea,*p I will gather you, and blow upon you in the fire of my wrath, and ye shall be melted in the midst thereof.
As*p silver is melted in the midst of the furnace, so shall ye be melted in the midst thereof; and ye shall know that I the Lord*s have poured out my fury upon you.
And*p the word of the Lord*s came unto me, saying,
Son*p of man, say unto her, Thou art the land that is not cleansed, nor rained upon in the day of indignation.

There*p is a conspiracy of her prophets in the midst thereof, like a roaring lion ravening the prey; they have devoured souls; they have taken the treasure and precious things; they have made her many widows in the midst thereof.

Her*p priests have violated my law, and have profaned mine holy things: they have put no difference between the holy and profane, neither have they shewed difference between the unclean and the clean, and have hid their eyes from my sabbaths, and I am profaned among them.
Her*p princes in the midst thereof are like wolves ravening the prey, to shed blood, and to destroy souls, to get dishonest gain.
And*p her prophets have daubed them with untempered mortar, seeing vanity, and divining lies unto them, saying, Thus saith the Lord God,*s when the Lord*s hath not spoken.
The*p people of the land have used oppression, and exercised robbery, and have vexed the poor and needy: yea, they have oppressed the stranger wrongfully.
And*p I sought for a man among them, that should make up the hedge, and stand in the gap before me for the land, that I should not destroy it: but I found none.
Therefore*p have I poured out mine indignation upon them; I have consumed them with the fire of my wrath: their own way have I recompensed upon their heads, saith the Lord God.*s
